definition: the four legendary beauties of ancient China, namely: Xishi 西施[Xi1 shi1], Wang Zhaojun 王昭君[Wang2 Zhao1 jun1], Diaochan 貂蟬|貂蝉[Diao1 Chan2] and Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2]
four/4
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
archaic variant of 汝[ru3]
female/woman/daughter

sentences.english: You know, Wang Zhaojun is one of "the four ancient beauties."
sentences.chinese: 王昭君是中國古代四大美女之一。

sentences.english: No , I only know Four Great Beauties.
sentences.chinese: 不知道，我只知道四大美女。

definition: lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
beauty/belle
femme fatale
a woman of unmatched beauty (idiom)
national grace, divine fragrance (idiom); an outstanding beauty
beauty unmatched in her generation (idiom); woman of peerless elegance/prettiest girl ever
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful

Xishi (c. 450 BC), famous Chinese beauty, foremost of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], given by King Gou Jian 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4] of Yue as concubine to King of Wu as part of a successful plan to destroy Wu
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
divine fragrance, national grace (idiom); an outstanding beauty
talented girl
(of a woman) remarkably beautiful/stunning

Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2] or Yang Guifei (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
famous courtesan
